alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 11:36PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Minor Coastal Flooding And Ice Push Possible Today Into This Evening... A strong storm now in the Central Chukchi Sea will move to north of Utqiagvik this afternoon and then well north of Kaktovik on Wed. This storm will bring West gales to most of the Western Arctic Coast as it moves east. This is expected to cause water levels along the coast to rise 3 feet above normal through late this evening. This will likely cause water to flow on top of the sea ice and river ice near the coast, and could cause minor flooding of low lying areas near the coast. Another concern is that sea ice is fractured and pushed offshore in many area from the east winds of the past several days, and that southwest winds could cause ice to push onshore (called an Ivu) in many areas, especially in areas that have developed open water leads near shore. Flooding of infrastructure is not expected but people should move valuables to higher ground. People should be alert for water pushing on top of snow machine trails that run over ice or along the coast. People should be alert for ice pushing onto beach areas and the possibility that ice could push inland in some areas.

area.areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Northwest Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast
